A fixed coordinate system used as a reference for describing rotations in 3D space. data.sampled: After performing the moves, the number 3 is on the front face. The Z rotation rotates the die around the z-axis, which is pointing outwards from the front face towards the observer. Since the die is initially oriented with the 3 on the front face, this rotation will move the 3 to the back face. The X rotation then rotates the die around the x-axis, which is pointing to the right from the observer's perspective. This rotation will bring the now back-facing 3 back to the front face, making it the number that is visible.

data.sampled:
The front face will now show the value 3.

Rotation X rotates the die 90 degrees about the X-axis, which is from right to left, so the front face will now show the value that was originally on the left-hand side.  Since there is a value of 5 on the bottom face, this will now appear on what was the left hand-side of the die, and what was originally on the front face will now be on what was the top face.

Rotation Z rotates the die 90 degrees about the Z-axis, which is towards/away from you, so the front face will now appear as the die originally did, except that what was on the top face has been moved to what was the back face.

So after these two rotations, the front face shows the value 3, which was originally on the left-hand face.

data.sampled:
After applying the sequence of moves Xx to the initial orientation of the die, the front face will show the number 6.

Rotation around the x-axis by 90° (clockwise) is represented by the letter X.

Rotation around the x-axis by -90° (counterclockwise) is represented by the letter x.

Rotation around the y-axis by 90° (clockwise) is represented by the letter Z.

Rotation around the y-axis by -90° (counterclockwise) is represented by the letter z.

Rotation around the z-axis by 90° (clockwise) is represented by the letter Y.

Rotation around the z-axis by -90° (counterclockwise) is represented by the letter y.

The given sequence of moves can be represented as Xx, which implies the following series of rotations:

1. Rotation around the x-axis by 90° (clockwise).
2. Rotation around the y-axis by 90° (clockwise).
3. Rotation around the x-axis by -90° (counterclockwise).

After applying these rotations, the front face of the die will show the number 6, since the initial orientation of the die is:

Front: 1, Top: 2, Left: 3, Bottom: 5, Right: 4, Back: 6.
Therefore, the number on the front face after the given sequence of moves is 6.

data.sampled:
I'm sorry, but I cannot determine what number will be on the front face after performing the moves Yx. In general, the number on the front face of a die after performing a sequence of rotations depends on the specific sequence of rotations.

However, I can provide some general information about how Yx rotations affect the orientation of a die. A Yx rotation is a combination of a Y rotation (rotating around the vertical axis) and an x rotation (rotating around the horizontal axis). The effect of a Yx rotation on the orientation of a die therefore depends on the initial orientation of the die and the direction of the rotations.

Here are some examples of how Yx rotations affect the orientation of a die:

1. If the die is initially oriented with the 1 facing up, a Yx rotation will rotate the die 90 degrees clockwise, so that the 6 faces up.

2. If the die is initially oriented with the 1 facing down, a Yx rotation will rotate the die 90 degrees counterclockwise, so that the 6 faces down.

3. If the die is initially oriented with a different face facing up, a Yx rotation will have a different effect depending on the direction of the rotations.

In order to determine what number will be on the front face after performing Yx rotations, it is necessary to know the initial orientation of the die and the direction of the rotations. If you provide this information, I can help you determine what number will be on the front face.

Your answer should only contain the number that is on the front face. Do not provide any further explanation.
